916854371:
[

Teach in China - Electrical & Renewable

Company Name Chisholm Institute Company Location Melbourne, AU

New Posted Date Posted 10 hours ago Number of views 5 views

Be an early applicant

Job description

  • Excellent Opportunity for a new challenge
  • Contracts from 1 month to 4 months
  • Flights & accommodation included


About Us

Chisholm is Victoria’s premier public vocational education and training provider, with campuses located across Melbourne and the south east.

A Victorian Government-owned TAFE, we aim to lead the way in education and training to inspire success and transform lives.

Our purpose is to excel in education and training and be respected and valued for enhancing the social and economic futures of individuals, industry and communities.

Our drive for commercial success is underpinned by our core values of Opportunity, Integrity, Collaboration, and Achievement.

We offer more than 400 courses, from VCE/VCAL/VETiS, through to nationally accredited qualifications such as certificates, diplomas, advanced diplomas, degrees, graduate certificates, graduate diplomas and short courses.

About The Role

We are delivering training within eight colleges throughout China and are seeking teachers with excellent credentials to deliver competencies from one or more of the following courses;

UET50212 - Diploma of ESI - Power Systems
UEE62011 - Adv. Dip. of Engineering Technology - Renewable Energy

You will be accountable for providing an opportunity for our Chinese students to gain an international qualification through your teaching excellence. Your primary focus will be on learner support, teaching delivery and learning assessment, resource development and educational administration.

Classes are conducted in English.

Your Key Accountabilities Will Be To
  • Plan education practices and delivery sessions that reflect the most effective way to engage learners
  • Proactively support the effective use of Institute learning resources and meet student needs by increasing the use of blended learning options, workplace or offsite delivery and mobile technologies
  • Demonstrate confidence and flexibility to manage the cultural challenges within the overseas teaching assignment.
  • Understand and empathise a cultural awareness and sensitivity for the country’s values where the teaching is required.
  • Design and develop teaching and learning resources including tailored materials in a range of formats to suit varying learning styles
  • Improve the quality of teaching and learning through a student based approach and adaptive curriculum
  • Adapt teaching materials to meet industry needs and specific tailored programs
  • Collaborate and develop key partnerships with industry bodies and employers to renew educational delivery practices and materials


About You
  • You will have a Certificate IV in Training and Assessment (TAE40110) (mandatory)
and/or Diploma in VET Practice (desirable).
  • You will also have vocational competency and industry currency in the relevant disciplines of Electrotechnology.
  • You will have a valid Victorian Employee Working With Children Check
  • Verification of unrestricted work rights in Australia, eg citizenship, passport or birth certificate

Crucial to your success will be your proven track record in planning programs, learning materials and teaching delivery plans as well as skills in transferring knowledge while having a strong understanding of contemporary approaches to education and learning.

You are a highly motivated professional who is able to motivate and guide students to optimise their learning outcomes.

You will also have some international experience whether professional or personal time spent abroad in other cultures.

You will embrace different cultures and backgrounds to ensure engagement and collegiality with all teaching members and students while on overseas assignments

Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander people are encouraged to apply.

OUR COMMITMENT TO DIVERSITY

At Chisholm, we embrace differences in gender, age, ethnicity, race, cultural background, disability, religion and sexual orientation. We know that diversity and inclusion helps us to attract, recruit, engage and retain a team of talented people. If you require specific support to apply for this position, please advise the recruiting manager whose contact details are listed in the advertisement. We will work with you to identify the best way to assist you.

How To Apply

Applications for this position close 5.00 pm Monday 31 December 2018

Applications Should Include
  • a covering letter
  • curriculum vitae
  • contact details of three (3) referees

Appointment to this position is subject to satisfactory completion of Safety Screening requirements including but not limited to:
  • National Police Check
  • International Police Check (if applicable)
  • Certified copies of qualifications

If you have any questions regarding the position or require further information please contact Aaron Winship, Phone +61 03 9238 8101 Email: Aaron.Winship@chisholm.edu.au

Chisholm Institute reserves the right to withdraw an advertised position at any stage.

  • Higher Education
  • Education Management

Direct Care Worker

Reference number: 12554

  • $29.53 - $32.60 per hour + superannuation

Moonee Valley City Council is currently recruiting for a motivated and enthusiastic Direct Care Worker to join the Healthy Ageing Unit within the Community Strengthening Department. This individual will support the independence of a diverse group of people within the Moonee Valley municipality through the provision of home, personal, respite care and social support.

Direct Care Workers are directly responsible for assisting eligible residents to fulfil their aspirations in accordance to their assessed needs and as outlined in the care plans by supporting and enabling the client with domestic tasks, general health and personal care needs, assistance with community access, promoting independence, and ensuring that each client receives a high level of care and support.

Education and Training Coordinator

Company Name Telstra Health Company Location Melbourne, Australia

Posted Date Posted 1 day ago Number of views 159 views

Be an early applicant

Job description


Education and Training Coordinator

TELSTRA HEALTH
The Telstra Health vision is to be the leading provider of digital health solutions that shape a connected future for healthcare in Australia.

THE TEAM
Telstra Health has partnered with the Australian Government to deliver and operate the Australian National Cancer Screening Register (NCSR); the register represents a unique industry approach based on the principle of 'one person, one health record'. To deliver this vision, Telstra Health is using the latest technology to integrate and extend the existing national bowel cancer register, and the eight separate state and territory-based cervical cancer registries, into one register. This means that not only will Australians have a single, digital health record they can access anytime, medical providers will be able to access patient records from their desktop to provide responsive and personalised care.


THE ROLE
The role of the Education and Training Coordinator is to lead and coordinate education and training to ensure the successful implementation of the Telstra Health National Cancer Screening Register (NCSR) Education and Training Plan.

The NCSR Education and Training Plan aims to prescribe a detailed Education and Training Plan for the End Users, Other Service Providers and NCSR Personnel to enable them to effectively use the National Cancer Screening Register and the National Cancer Screening Programs business process that they support.

The following are key responsibilities of the role:
Reporting to the General Manager of Operations the Education and Training Coordinator will work with the broader NCSR operational team to:

  • Lead, manage and develop education and training for the NCSR, with particular focus on the development and education of internal operational staff.
  • Work collaboratively with multiple stakeholders including Commonwealth, States and Territories, NCSR staff and Health professionals.
  • Expertise in flexible learning environments
  • Self-motivated with the desire to work in a fast-paced environment



In order to be successful in the position, you will need the following:

  • Proven work experience in coordinating multiple training modules and programs.
  • Demonstrated expertise and experience in coordinating education and training for multiple stakeholder groups
  • Demonstrated experience in developing, delivering and evaluating informal and formal education programs and training for adult learners
  • Demonstrated experience in delivering education and working with service providers to construct on-line learning modules.
  • Experience with multiple modalities for course delivery including online learning and use of learning management systems
  • Ability to work in a multidisciplinary team environment.
  • Australian Government Security Vetting Agency Baseline Security Clearance. Australian Citizenship is an essential criteria for this application.


So to build your career and join an iconic Australian company with a rich heritage please click the APPLY NOW button.

918184308:
[

Senior Manager, Events and Training

Company Name UITP Company Location Melbourne, Victoria, Australia

New Posted Date Posted 24 hours ago Number of views 57 views

Be an early applicant

Job description

  • Lead our training and events programme
  • Dynamic, positive environment and working culture
  • Enjoy lots of flexibility and a great career development opportunity

\xa0

This is a dynamic role where you will enjoy flexibility and autonomy to create, plan and deliver an innovative and exciting training and events programme for UITP (International Association of Public Transport) in the Australia/New Zealand region (known as UITPANZ).

\xa0

UITPANZ is the leading public transport industry association in the region. We’re a member-based association that engages with government, industry and research institutions to promote public transport best practice.


Located in Docklands, Melbourne however candidates from other cities will be considered as we support flexible working practices. There is an expectation that some time would be spent in Melbourne.

\xa0

We’re looking for someone with significant experience in events/training strategy, planning and delivery. This role would suit someone who is comfortable working at a strategic level but also thrives in tactical planning and delivery. As this is a hands-on role, a positive can-do attitude is a must! We’re looking for someone with experience curating compelling programmes and content, including identifying and securing presenters, as well as managing event coordination and logistics. Professional development is supported and encouraged.

\xa0

Ideal candidates will have outstanding stakeholder management and communications skills, a willingness to travel, a growth mindset and take pride in delivering high quality events.

\xa0

This role will manage all aspects of events and training delivery. Note this role is not expected to facilitate training programs, but rather curate and coordinate training with various presenters and facilitators. The position is also responsible for managing associated administration, communications and marketing content and planning, and event logistics. There is a requirement for some interstate travel and infrequent international level.

\xa0

KEY ACCOUNTABILITIES

  • Develop a strategic annual program of training and events.
  • Plan and deliver high quality events, training and networking opportunities.
  • Work with membership base to develop sponsorship opportunities for events, where relevant.
  • Research and identify content and speakers.
  • Identify events and training needs of members, review and evaluate of events and training offering, and refresh events and training offering to meet current and future expectations of members.
  • Keep abreast of local and international public transport trends, themes and policy issues to inform the development of innovative and contemporary programmes for events and training.
  • Plan out necessary marketing and communications activities related to events and training and assist in the execution of this plan.
  • Complete board reporting, manage events budgets, negotiate supplier agreements and complete invoicing.
  • Engage with head office staff to identify/plan events and determine mechanisms to enhance value for local members.
  • Other duties as directed by the Executive Director.


SKILLS & EXPERIENCE

  • Significant experience in event planning, management and delivery, especially in creating a program of professional development events.\xa0
  • Bachelor’s degree, diploma or equivalent experience.
  • Demonstrated stakeholder management experience, particularly engagement with senior executives.
  • Some knowledge of the public transport landscape in Australia/New Zealand or willingness to learn.
  • Ability to work autonomously, flexibly and with limited direction.
  • Superior written and verbal communications skills, including presentation skills.
  • Strong interpersonal skills, detail-oriented and ability to manage multiple tasks simultaneously.\xa0
  • A proactive can-do attitude, display initiative and growth mindset.
  • Skilled in the use of Microsoft Office software, particularly Word, Excel, Outlook and PowerPoint.
  • Ability to work in a cross-cultural and multi-lingual environment (although knowledge of languages other than English is not mandatory).

\xa0

If you are someone that can work autonomously and enjoys managing the full cycle of an event this is the role for you!


Remuneration will be negotiated with the successful candidate with consideration to skills and experience. This is a full-time role offered on a two-year contract, with options to extend.


If this sounds like you, please Apply Now with your resume and covering letter. Applications close COB Monday 29 October 2018. For more information please contact Michelle Batsas, Executive Director UITPANZ at michelle.batsas@uitp.org

I-MED Radiology Network, Australia's largest medical imaging network is recruiting a WHS Coordinator to provide high quality, accurate and timely WHS and injury management advice, support and leadership to our Regional Imaging Business Unit for the safety of employees, patients, customers and the community.

We also assist financial institutions including ASX listed entities and work with some of Australia’s leading Not-For-Profit organisations by making sure that they are working within their legal frameworks and requirements. By employing the highest calibre of people who are passionate about helping people, we strive to keep our clients safe, providing them with a complete Governance, Risk, Compliance and Policy Management solution. We take the worry out of meeting legal obligations. We know when there is a change in policy or an update in regulations and we update our clients accordingly. If clients need assistance with the functionality of their service, we’re here to help. Our products and platforms are essential to what we do, but our people are what sets us apart. We are dedicated and committed to the work that we do and we make a difference to people’s lives every day.


With 100 staff across our offices in Sydney, Melbourne, Brisbane, Adelaide and Perth we currently work with over 700 organisations and have strong consulting practices in the non-government school sector, commercial and financial services, as well as community housing. \xa0


About the Role


We are currently experiencing strong demand to expand our service offering within the NFP sector \xa0and have an exceptional opportunity on offer for a Head of Consulting - Commercial/NFP. This is a national role that can be based in either Melbourne or Sydney.


In this dynamic role, you will be in a unique position where you can make a difference, helping NFP organisations to implement effective organisational governance programs that will enable them to better achieve their stated vision and strategic objectives.


As our Head of Consulting - Commercial/NFP, you will be empowered to leverage our current ways of working to grow this area of our consulting practice. Your primary functions will be to:


  • Act as the lead on complex client governance, risk, compliance and policy (GRC&P) management projects;
  • Build a high performance consulting team to service our NFP clients as the practice grows;
  • Provide content and consulting expertise with respect to our key practice areas as they relate to our NFP clients;
  • Work directly with our editorial, consulting and client learning teams to ensure best practice GRC&P outcomes for our NFP clients;
  • Represent CompliSpace as a thought leader in the NFP organisational governance space presenting at industry conferences and facilitating client workshops.
  • Leverage your existing networks to form relationships with NFP organisations and industry associations.

\xa0

About You


To be successful in this role you will require a strong working knowledge of:


  • Contemporary board governance practices;
  • The key organisational governance practice areas of enterprise risk management, compliance, complaints handling and policy management;
  • Other key practice areas such as human resources management, workplace safety, privacy, business continuity management and fraud & corruption control
  • Organisation change management practices with the ability to quickly assess a client’s GRC maturity levels and work with clients over time to enable their governance capabilities;
  • Agile project management methodologies;


To be considered for the role you will need the following:


  • A tertiary qualification preferably in business or law;
  • At least 10 years' experience in executive and/or management consulting roles;
  • Excellent verbal and written communication skills;
  • Strong leadership abilities;
  • Exceptional presentation skills
  • Demonstrable ability to:
    • manage complex consulting projects across a range of industry sectors;
    • oversee / manage multiple projects at one time to ensure effective quality control;
    • work effectively cross functional teams;
    • build a team in a growth environment;
    • work with a variety of technology platforms (experience with a GRC software platforms, collaboration and project management platforms will be well regarded)
  • Proven experience in dealing with CEO's, executive managers and directors;
  • Experience in the NFP sector will be well regarded;


Just as importantly your personal characteristics will result in success in this role. In this regard it is critical that you are aligned to CompliSpace’s cultural values of: \xa0

Courage:\xa0You tell it how it is. You have the courage to listen, speak up, make tough decisions, take smart risks and learn from mistakes.

Ownership:\xa0You know your stuff. You take ownership of your individual work and collaborate as part of a team. You focus on delivering results.

Manner:\xa0Your manner matters. You respect people around you - clients, colleagues, providers and collaborators. Ethics guide you.

Positivity:\xa0Your positive energy inspires others. You bring a can-do energy to work, connect with people and contribute with passion.

Learn:\xa0You're curious and embrace learning. You share your knowledge and learn from others as well.

Innovate:\xa0You challenge the status quo. You seek better ways to do things, encouraging ideas and daring to experiment.


By working at CompliSpace you can be part of a team that makes a difference in people's lives. We strive to simplify governance, risk, compliance and policy management so that our clients can focus on their core vision and objectives.

\xa0


\xa0

Job description

MACPHERSON KELLEY

Macpherson Kelley is a hands-on commercial law firm, known for our business mindset, client service, innovation and investment in great relationships. With offices across Victoria, New South Wales and Queensland and a formal company structure, we offer you the opportunity to build your career in the real business world.

It is our goal for our clients, and our people, to be our strongest advocates.

OPPORTUNITY

An exciting and rare opportunity has arisen for an Office Services Assistant to join our newly refurbished Melbourne office. This busy role provides support to the Office Services Manager and on a range of office-based services including, but not limited to
  • Inventory stock takes and follow up on discrepancies
  • Relief for reception and concierge
  • Preparing induction kits,
  • Site inductions,
  • Office/work station set up & turnarounds,
  • Disposal of destruction bins,
  • Archiving retrievals & collections and associated admin and file management,
  • Meet, greet & liaise with technicians and contractors,
  • Lodgement of approved maintenance service calls ,
  • Titles support – banking and lodgements,
  • Distribution of mail and courier parcels within the office,
  • General tenancy tidiness
  • Support with ad hoc requests as they arise,

The office is friendly, bright and easy-going so it would be great if you have a similar nature and a, "can do" attitude.

ABOUT YOU

This role is ideally suited to someone who enjoys variety as you will be assisting with a broad range of work. This is an excellent foot in the door for anyone looking for a career in Office Services or facilities management and in order to be successful, you need to be pro-active, well organised and confident.

Ideally, we are looking for someone who has previous customer service or administrative experience. A knowledge of legal process is helpful, however not necessary. This is a busy role so, as a keen multi-tasker, you must have excellent attention to detail, strong time management skills as well as developed communication skills.

In order to be successful at Macpherson Kelley, you will naturally understand and share our values – talk straight, play as a team and be better each day. You will bring with you your excellent interpersonal skills and client service mentality.

The successful applicant will be required to undertake and satisfy a National Police Records Check.

THE EXTRAS

There are many benefits that we offer to support our flexible, innovative and positive work environment. There are purchase leave options as well as recognition incentives. We also offer social, wellness, sporting and community based activities. We are proud to offer genuine flexibility through our Flex+ program.

If all of the above sounds like you, we would love to hear from you. You can apply directly or contact Paige Knapton on (03) 9794 2511 for a confidential discussion.

Senior Credit Risk Systems Analyst

Company Name ME Bank Company Location Melbourne CBD, Melbourne, Australia

New Posted Date Posted 2 hours ago Number of views 13 views

Be an early applicant

Job description


Let's talk about ME



We're not like other banks.


ME was created by the industry super funds to be different from the pack \xad- and we're passionate about staying that way as we head into an exciting and progressive future. We are building a bank, a company and a brand that we can be proud of - but to achieve that, we need the best people.

To help ME get there, you'll challenge the status quo and share extraordinary ideas - and our size guarantees you'll have the opportunity, support and environment to be heard.


ME's core purpose is helping all Australians get ahead - no conditions, asterisks or exceptions.


We believe everyone deserves the same opportunities in life, regardless of gender or identity, sexuality, ethnicity or religion. This is why we're so committed to an equal opportunity workplace - because we know our success won't come from focusing on similarities, but by embracing and celebrating our diversity.



Let's talk about the JOB



If you're passionate about introducing new changes and solving complex problems that directly improves customer's experience, this could be the role for you. Sitting within the Credit Risk team, this is a role that requires a highly collaborative individual who has sound knowledge of Consumer Lending and Retail Credit Risk and Collections.


Reporting to our Senior Manager Mortgages Credit Strategy, this role will focus on analysing business needs to identify opportunities for improvement in strategies contained within Credit Risk systems, across Home Loans, Credit Cards and Personal Loans.


Utilising your knowledge of the credit risk life cycle, you'll proactively drive best practice development in a fast-paced, highly regulated agile environment across Credit Risk and IT. Taking full end to end ownership of business, functional and non-functional requirements, you'll also collaborate with Credit Risk stakeholders to understand their needs, business priorities, concerns and the environment that they operate.

Providing functional expertise to solution designers, developers, testers and business groups, you'll demonstrate outstanding written and verbal communication skills as well as proficient stakeholder management skills.



This is a great opportunity to establish and maintain working relationships across ME's IT development and architecture communities as well as wider business stakeholders and system users. With high levels of autonomy and influence, this role is perfect for someone who wants to have a big impact.



Let's talk about YOU



With experience working with stakeholders across all levels, you're a solid influencer who has a track record driving successful outcomes. You genuinely care about understanding your stakeholders' true needs, and take this into consideration for each and every decision made.

You bring your experience and knowledge of credit decisioning into this role, along with solid experience in credit policy, credit limit management, risk based pricing and scorecards in order to compliment new and exciting initiatives at ME.

Your technical toolkit will include knowledge and experience of decision engines including Probe, NBSM, Triad or the like, and you are experienced in analysing data using statistical packages such as SAS, and SQL. A demonstrated experience with data mapping and data dictionaries would also be advantageous.


As a proactive agile team member, you happily jump in and assist when required to swarm around blockers, coaching and guiding other team members and broader stakeholders on agile business analysis.


If you have a strong desire to be part of an organisation that fosters a culture of collaboration and ownership from its people, perhaps you should apply now?




About the Perks

At ME, we believe that work should be a place that you can make the most of - and these are just some of the many reasons why people love it here:

  • Popular culture - that's not a claim, we've got the data to prove it. We genuinely care about each other and work in an encouraging and collaborative environment.
  • The whole package - sure, we're going to reward you well with your salary package - but there are also lots of other perks - including discounted Myki travel cards, free health support, conveniently-located offices, plus much more.
  • Not afraid to fail? We embrace action-oriented people like you. That's right, you can make mistakes here and it's ok - so long as you learn from them.
  • To be ME, we need you - we're building something really cool and you get to directly influence what that is.
  • ProudlyME - our internal pride network - has a swag of initiatives that show support, education, and passion toward our team and customers, demonstrating that ME is a strong advocate on equal rights for the LGBTIQ+ community.
  • Meet the Execs - our Executive team is fun and full of passion because we know great managers mean happy staff.


Oh, and did we mention you get your very own ME branded Converse High-top shoes? Now that's a reason to get your foot in the door.



I was born to play this role.


If this sounds like the perfect job for you, why wait? Apply now by submitting your cover letter and resume today.




Should an applicant be the preferred candidate, background checks (including police checks, reference checks, ASIC banned and disqualified persons and bankruptcy checks) will be completed prior to the candidate's employment being confirmed. The outcomes of the background checks do not automatically bar candidates; however will be assessed against the inherent requirements of the job.

Team and Marketing Coordinator

Company Name Cushman & Wakefield Company Location Melbourne, AU

New Posted Date Posted 1 hour ago Number of views 10 views

Job description

Job Title
Team and Marketing Coordinator

Job Description Summary

Reporting into the Joint Heads of Office Leasing and based in our Melbourne CBD office, this role will provide administrative and marketing support to the Office Leasing team, ensuring efficient operations at all times.

About The Role

Job Description

Reporting into the Joint Heads of Office Leasing and based in our Melbourne CBD office, this role will provide administrative and marketing support to the Office Leasing team, ensuring efficient operations at all times. You will be a positive and proactive member of a growing team who is keen multitasker and able respond to team and management requests in a timely manner.

What You Will Do
  • Preparing and coordinating leasing submissions including design and structure in InDesign as well as coordinating with external marketing companies.
  • Coordinating LinkedIn media strategy for Office leasing
  • Assist Office Leasing with the preparation and production of reports both amending (including tracked changes/revision marks) and copy typing.
  • Assisting Office Leasing department in putting together lease proposals and heads of agreement documentation.
  • Assisting with events, corporate lunches and presentations when required: Coordinate boardroom presentations onsite, including catering
  • Provide administrative support to the leasing team, including typing, file management, minutes, and coordination of marketing.
  • Assist with the extraction of listings for up-load to online advertising
  • Creation of job files upon request.
  • Coordinating the archiving of soft files and hard files to storage, including allocating leases and contracts of sale.
  • Maintain Salesforce database relevant to areas of role, including maintaining of Office Leasing client contacts
  • Maintaining leasing agent details in all relevant areas
  • Booking of Office Leasing staff client trips and lunch/dinner bookings
  • Submission of agent expense claims
  • Format correspondence, submissions, presentations as and when required
  • Assisting with information or reporting requests from the management team.
  • Preparing and updating leasing minutes on a weekly basis and provide forecasting/minutes to Finance Department as required
  • Attend internal and external meetings as required
  • Managing financial reporting on behalf of the team
  • Managing IT issues and submitting queries to the IT department on behalf of the team

What You Will Bring
  • Diploma / Certificate in Business Administration
  • 3 years similar experience in a commercial real estate agency or senior administrative role
  • InDesign experience is an advantage.
  • Salesforce, JDE experience is desirable
  • Excellent operational knowledge of Microsoft Office essential, including Outlook, Word and PowerPoint. Basic Excel knowledge is required.
  • Knowledge of the commercial property industry is an advantage
  • Proactive in improving work efficiency within the team
  • Strong interpersonal and verbal communication skills
  • Proven ability to work effectively in a team-oriented environment
  • Demonstrated organisational skills and ability to prioritise
As an equal opportunity employer, Cushman & Wakefield encourages Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander and female candidates to apply. Cushman & Wakefield promotes safety at all times.

Job description

JOB DESCRIPTION AND KEY RESPONSIBILITIES

\xa0\xa0\xa0

Working within a team environment, you will be responsible for the scheduling of all Engineering work on a fully automated container terminal.

You will be responsible for assessing work and equipment availability to produce work schedules in a high paced, dynamic environment, considering operational needs, sub-contractors and plant availability. The role will also focus on continual improvement of the overall planning efficiency and work dispatching.

\xa0

Duties


Producing work orders in SAP from handovers or scheduled tasks, Identifying and prioritising work as required.


Scoping and planning identified work in both weekly and monthly forecasts and preparing paper work to complete tasks.


Create a clear hand over to Work Group


Work with Supervisors, Managers and Work Group Leaders to ensure work tasks are completed, including resource utilisation, completion rates, service standards, working collaboratively to generate short and long term improvements.


Take a proactive approach to continuous improvement in the areas of safety, quality, and cost control (efficiency).


Experience


You have demonstrated experience within a Planning / Scheduling role. Previous experience and/or knowledge of container handing or heavy industrial equipment is highly advantageous.


With previous experience in SAP you will also have a high level of computer system literacy including MS Project and MS Excel.


You will be a logical thinking and Team Player, having excellent interpersonal skills and stakeholder engagement.


What you will enjoy


Working in a friendly, diverse and supportive team environment, focused on achieving results on new state of the art equipment.


Working Monday to Friday with flexible working hours considered


Access to discretionary Company Bonus Scheme


Above State average Superannuation


Great Port Melbourne location

Job description

Ultradata Australia is seeking an experienced Business Analyst to join our Design Team. This position is based in our Head Office located in Malvern East.


The purpose of this role is to provide highly skilled analysis, specification, design and workflow services that create innovative solutions for new and updated product functionality.


The role will suit a Business Analyst who has broad experience within retail banking and is familiar with current technology platforms.


Role & Responsibilities:


  • Undertake banking market trend analysis and recommend potential product enhancements;
  • Research and monitor the latest trends and technologies and provide suggestions on how they can impact the funtionality on our product offerings:
  • Develop reference documents that specify requirements and business rules, workflows, functional design, user interface designs and database design, depending on the nature of the assigned project;
  • Develop sound client relationships and revenue generating opportunities through the provision of specific fee-based consulting activities;
  • Analyse client and prospective client requirements, matching those with Ultradata products and services;
  • Assist Sales, Client Services and Marketing teams to define and deliver key messages on Ultradata products and services;
  • Deliver product and functionality overviews to the Ultradata team to ensure knowledge of new and updated products are shared;
  • Disseminate knowledge within Ultradata of existing and new products via a range of techniques suchas seminars, workshops, training sessions, printed collateral, knowledge base, frequently asked questions etc;
  • Participate in the provision of programs to improve the knowledge and talent collateral of clients and Ultradta employees on the functionality and application of existing and new solutions.


Skills, Competencies and Experience:


  • Relvant Tertiary Qualifications (Computer Science/Inforamtion Systems Business, Commerce, Economics) and/or extensive commercial experience;
  • Proven experience as a Business Analyst;
  • Prior experience working within banking and technology fields;
  • Legislative knowledge within the banking domain (highly desirable);
  • Familiarity with current technologies and devices;
  • Ability to provide creative commercial solutions using new and evolving technologies;
  • Ability to contirbute ideas and take ownership of assigned tasks;
  • Proven ability to manage priorities and time to meet assigned goals and deadlines;
  • Ability to build credible stakeholder relationships;
  • Ability to credibly translate information to different audiences;
  • Enthusiasm for creating financial services and banking solutions.


Please note, only shortlisted applicants will be contacted.


Applicants must have Australian Citizenship/Permanent Residency to be considered for this position.

Head of Market Development- ANZ (Melbourne or Sydney based)

Company Name Michael Page Company Location Melbourne, Australia

Posted Date Posted 1 day ago Number of views 110 views

Be an early applicant

Job description


An exciting Diagnostics Sales leadership role responsible for five exciting therapy/ product areas within the business.


Client Details


QIAGEN is a leading global provider of sample and assay technologies for molecular diagnostics, applied testing, academic and pharmaceutical research. Its strong investment into research and development has led to their thriving environment and strong product growth in recent years. The company has continued to experience substantial growth, leading to an exciting opportunity to join their market development team.


Description


Reporting to the General Manager-ANZ you will be managing a team of five Market Development Manager's nationally and be responsible for growing this integral part of the business. You will lead from the front and work in a highly autonomous manner to achieve results.


As a key member of the leadership team, your responsibilities will include:

  • Growing the overall business segments under your supervision which will include X5 Market Development Manager's across various therapy areas including: Academia, Genomics, Biox, Quantiferon etc.
  • Playing a very hands-on role coaching and developing the team of Market Development Managers so that they have the skills and tools to achieve targets
  • Implementation of company strategy through specific territory plans considering current market trends
  • Responsible for the development and monitoring of the monthly, quarterly and annual sales targets
  • Ensure forecast accuracy, pipeline management and customer satisfaction and compliance with the requested reporting
  • Working closely with customers in ANZ and strengthening relations with key decision makers and KOL's
  • Working collaboratively with the local leadership team as well as colleagues internationally


Profile


You will be a highly driven and experienced Sales leader with an aptitude and passion for sales and a strong aspiration for new challenges. The successful applicant will have:

  • Tertiary qualifications (ideally a Business or Science Degree) Masters or equivalent preferred
  • Minimum of 5 years of Sales experience in the Diagnostics space having worked locally
  • Minimum of 3 years of proven successful leadership, and budget experience
  • Strong knowledge of the clinical laboratory environment
  • Clinical experience in the Academia, Genomics, Women's Health, Immunology, Pathology segments will also be highly regarded as well as solid experience within the broader Diagnostics Medical Device world
  • Excellent problem-solving skills
  • Knowledge of the competitor landscape will be highly advantageous for this role as well as a strong understanding of the overall market and where the specific opportunities lie currently. You will be highly accountable in the role and be innovative and quick to make decisions


    • Job Offer


    The successful individual will be part of a highly collaborative community and have the opportunity to work with a leading global research-based company within a dynamic and fast-paced environment. The company offers the successful candidate career progression and tools and support to succeed.

    • A highly competitive Base Salary + Super + Car Allowance
    • A generous commission/ bonus scheme
    • Various other fringe benefits


    To apply online please click the 'Apply' button below. For a confidential discussion about this role please contact David Bayliss on +61 2 8292 2512

Company Name JLL Company Location Melbourne, AU

New Posted Date Posted 5 hours ago Number of views 13 views

Job description

Job Description

Have you ever walked into a shopping centre and just enjoyed being there? You don’t know why, or what makes it different – you just know you’d like to work, shop or visit there more? Well, we’re pretty proud to say we’re the ones who make that happen.

JLL work at the heart of buildings, also ensuring the building is safe, clean and everything is in good working order. But our true value-add for our clients is putting our customers first and creating places that people want to be

What This Job Involves

Leading a team of Marketing, Operations and Administration professionals based at a large sub-regional shopping centre in Melbourne’s north, you will encourage a culture of innovation & sustainability amongst the team and continually look for new ways of doing things to add value for our client.
You will be responsible for the delivery of the centres business plan objectives, minimise arrears, maximise property income and actively assist in the delivery of the operating and capital expenditure budgets.
Providing superior client service and being the first point of contact for the client to ensure that all centre staff provide same service standards will be essential.

Sound like you? This is what we’re looking for-

A true retail professional with proven success in Shopping Centre Management your focus will be both strategic and operational, spanning all aspects of Retail Management. .
You will have a strong financial acumen, demonstrated communication skills and the ability to deal confidently with Clients, Tenants, Staff and the broader community. You will have a strategic and commercial mindset and strong negotiation skills both in developing relationships and resolving disputes or problems as they arise.
Naturally, you are results driven; consistently delivering high levels of service and performance to all stakeholders. It is critical that you have leadership qualities to manage and develop staff. Qualifications in property or business disciplines will be highly regarded as well as your proven financial capabilities.

What can you expect from us?

You’ll join an entrepreneurial, inclusive culture. One where the best inspire the best. Where like-minded people work naturally together to achieve great things. Join us to develop your strengths and enjoy a fulfilling career full of varied experiences. Keep those ambitions in sight and imagine where JLL can take you...

JLL is committed to developing and maintaining a diverse workforce. We encourage Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islanders applications and enquiries.
